skill.name: docs-review
skill.description: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewing pull requests, files, or diffs containing documentation markdown files.
skill.summary: Review documentation for style guide compliance and readability improvements
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation review tool that checks markdown files against the Metabase writing style guide. All 40 static findings were false positives from pattern matching on documentation content. The skill legitimately uses Read, Grep, Glob, and Bash tools for reviewing documentation changes in pull requests or local files. No actual security risks identified.

content.user_title: Review Documentation for Style Guide Compliance
content.value_statement: Documentation inconsistencies reduce clarity and professionalism. This skill automatically reviews documentation changes against the Metabase writing style guide to ensure consistent tone, structure, and formatting.
actual_capabilities: Review documentation files against Metabase writing style guide rules
Check tone and voice for conversational style and appropriate language
Validate structure and clarity including headings, paragraphs, and information hierarchy
Verify formatting consistency for code elements and UI references
Identify terminology preferences and suggest familiar alternatives
Post numbered feedback as GitHub PR review comments or local conversation output
limitations: Designed specifically for Metabase style guide and may not apply to other documentation standards
Requires manual judgment for context-specific style decisions
Cannot verify factual accuracy or technical correctness of documentation content
Works only with markdown files and may not handle other documentation formats

use_cases.title: Pull Request Documentation Review
use_cases.description: Automatically review documentation changes in GitHub pull requests and post numbered feedback as review comments to help maintainers ensure consistency.
use_cases.target_user: Open source maintainers and technical writers

use_cases.title: Local Documentation Editing
use_cases.description: Review documentation files locally before committing to catch style issues early and reduce review iterations.

use_cases.title: Documentation Quality Audit
use_cases.description: Audit existing documentation for style guide compliance to identify areas needing improvement and maintain consistent voice across large documentation sets.

prompt_templates.title: Review a Documentation File
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the file docs/getting-started.md for style guide compliance
prompt_templates.scenario: Basic file review for a single markdown file

prompt_templates.title: Review Pull Request Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the documentation changes in pull request 1234
prompt_templates.scenario: GitHub PR review with automated comment posting

prompt_templates.title: Review Multiple Documentation Files
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all markdown files in the docs/guides directory for style issues
prompt_templates.scenario: Batch review of multiple documentation files

prompt_templates.title: Review Specific Style Aspects
prompt_templates.prompt: Review docs/api-reference.md focusing on tone, heading structure, and code formatting
prompt_templates.scenario: Targeted review focusing on specific style guide sections

output_examples.input: Review docs/installation.md for style guide compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone - Line 15: This could be more conversational. Consider using contractions: "You can't" instead of "You cannot"
Issue 2: Vague heading - Line 8: The heading could be more specific. Try stating the point directly: "Run migrations before upgrading" instead of "Upgrade process"
Issue 3: Descriptive link text - Line 42: Avoid linking the word "here". Use descriptive link text: "Read the installation guide" instead of "Click here"

output_examples.output: Posted 4 numbered review comments to GitHub PR 5678 covering tone consistency, heading clarity, and formatting issues

best_practices: Run the review after understanding the documentation intent to provide context-aware feedback
Focus on issues that materially impact reader comprehension and skip minor stylistic preferences
Use PR review mode for GitHub pull requests to post all feedback as one cohesive review
anti_patterns: Reviewing documentation without reading through the changes first to understand overall intent
Flagging every minor style deviation without considering whether it materially improves readability
Posting review comments individually instead of collecting all issues and posting them together in PR mode

faq.question: What documentation formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for markdown documentation files. It reviews markdown syntax, headings, code blocks, and text content against the Metabase writing style guide.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for documentation that does not follow the Metabase style guide?
faq.answer: The skill is specifically calibrated for Metabase style guide rules. While some principles are universal, many checks are Metabase-specific and may not apply to other documentation standards.

faq.question: How does the skill decide between PR review mode and local review mode?
faq.answer: The skill automatically detects if GitHub MCP tools are available. If the mcp github create pending pull request review tool is available, it uses PR mode and posts comments to GitHub. Otherwise, it outputs numbered feedback in the conversation.

faq.question: Why are all issues numbered sequentially?
faq.answer: Sequential numbering allows efficient reference and tracking. Users can say fix issues 1, 3, and 5 and clearly know which feedback items to address without ambiguity.

faq.question: Does this skill fix documentation issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reviews and identifies issues. It provides numbered feedback with suggested fixes that users can apply manually. This preserves author intent and context-specific decisions.

faq.question: Can this skill verify technical accuracy of documentation content?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on writing style, tone, structure, and formatting. It does not verify factual accuracy, code examples functionality, or technical correctness of the documented features.
